intro: Synaphea polymorpha, commonly known as the common synaphea, is a species of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its small, leafy structure with a distinct thallus. The plant exhibits a variety of morphological forms, which contributes to its common name "polymorpha." It typically grows on soil or rock surfaces in temperate regions. Synaphea polymorpha plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
